poem:
Fragile Lands

In Goma's shadow,  
fear is woven through the cries—  
hunger hums a bitter song,  
as Judith, weary merchant,  
curses this war,  
her words trickling through dust  
like unseen tears,  
while hope,  
a thin thread frays—  
cut off, yet still  
a whisper clings to  
tomorrow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I curse this war’: hunger and fear in Goma after rebel takeover People living in Goma on the Democratic Republic of the Congo’s eastern border with Rwanda have spoken of their fear and acute hunger after the M23 rebel group swept into the city earlier this week. “We are very afraid. This situation feels hopeless,” said Judith Saima, a 28-year-old merchant in Goma, where heavy fighting that cut the city off from the outside world". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
